column4: I have /home owned as a user, who is supposed to own this dir
astro76 thankyou, I need a cmd to run to fix my /home permissions every file is owned by one user and not there own
yes I know, /home/* is owned by one user now
I don't understand.  A file/directory can only be owned by one user.
Ohh, you mean that the home directorys are owned by other users?  You will have to chown each one.
Like, if a user named moo should own /home/moo, do chown -R moo:moo /home/moo
ok, my permissions via chmod for each user are screwed up, gnome wont let me in any user, what is the default permission for all files in /home/"user"
I don't understand waht you mean by default permission.
when I login gnome it kicks me out saying you must chmod 644 .dmrc and I do so and it still dont work
That's a hard question.  Some should be 644, some should be 755, some should be 600.
The directory by default should be 755, or 700.
It may be easier to re-create the users.
nah I fixed it thankyou bro
